intro: Solenanthus tenuiflorus, commonly known as the slender-flowered solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
